Reviews.Title: “Dave Ancient Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Short stay in February. Room was warm and comfortable,v good condition, and well appointed. Booked breakfast at nearby Tashkonak Hotel . Excellent and interesting. Panoramic Breakfast room first treat of day. Service friendly and most helpful at all times. Location great for Main sites but all uphill, need to be a reasonable walker. Good transport links and facilities on main street again up hill.Good local restaurants ( make sure they do ( or don't) serve alcohol according to your persuasion. Character Hotel, Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: SappyAdventures
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! We were traveling with our two young boys and also another family with 2 young children. The location was perfect - within 2 blocks of the Blue Mosque and walking distance to all major attractions! The breakfast was included and was a very good buffet with a variety of choices (warm and cold) and was held on the top of the hotel with a nice view. The staff was very friendly and helpful with recommendations and setting up transport to and from the airport. The room size was also very large and had modern amenities. We felt very lucky to have chosen this hotel. We'd definitely recommend it to anyone and stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: sonrisa18
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic and great value for our money! It offers great location and the rooms is very nice and large with a kitchenette. The staff was wonderful, extremely friendly and helpful. They always answered our questions about what and where to go/see. The free Wi-Fi in the room worked great and the room was beautifully decorated. It was a large room and very comfortable. All the attractions were within walking distance, yet it is just far enough from all the noise, making the location perfect. The breakfast buffet was good and had many choices. Also, if paying with cash, they give a discount. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!!!”
Reviews.Author: love1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at tashkonak apartments and suites for 6 nights in Istanbul in Dec. While searching for hotels on TA we were not sure how the hotel would be actually. We have to admit that it has been a lovely stay. Great suite, super clean and comfortable beds and sheets and feet location. The breakfast served is also nice with offerings of omelettes. The staff is very helpful. We would definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay and will go back every time”
Reviews.Author: bobnMoruyaAustralia
Reviews.Content: Staff so friendly and helpful. Room was excellent and so clean and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and I love my coffee of which there was plenty. The location is wonderful, so close to historical sites and I was able to walk where I wanted to go. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot”
Reviews.Author: karenp27
Reviews.Content: Located close to Blue Mosque with stunning views of the sea at breakfast and shady terrace garden. Staff went out of their way and were friendly and helpful. Top marks. This is the sixth Hotel we have stayed in Istanbul and its the best so far.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suites with the best customer service”
Reviews.Author: travellerish
Reviews.Content: I was travelling alone and had heard scary stories about turkish men following/flirting with ladies as well as pickpocketers. Once i arrived to the hotel, they gave me a suite all to myself. 'Hayatti', front desk officer extremely helpful with getting me tours (highly recommend his suggestions) as well as each time i wanted to get to a location he would guide me on the map. I had looked up an opening ceremony of the Istanbul Music Festival, he helped me locate tickets and asked them to reserve them for me. He helped in converting my dollars and on the last day when i wanted to buy turkish delights, he walked with me to the shop and got the delights for me. The breakfast and other amneties were perfect. The location and hospitality is the best part of the hotel. Their new hotel: Sultan's Royal which will be inaugurated next week is another jewel in this neighbourhood which is just 2 minutes away from Tashkonak. The manager, showed me the premises and it is exquisite with a private terrace to the top rooms and reading lights on beds and amazingly beautiful bathroom. A must must recommended hotel ! Shopping Tip : Arasta Bazaar right next to the hotel is the same, at times cheaper prices from the grand bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location - recommended”
Reviews.Author: ChWh
Reviews.Content: Hotel and Suites Tashkonak are very well located - close to the major tourist sites in Sultanahmet and just a short walk to the tram which takes you over to the lively Beyoglu area. The suite we stayed in was very comfortable and everyone at the hotel was pleasant and helpful. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Handsome studio apartments in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Tora-in-Rome
Reviews.Content: We rented two studio apartments, and stayed for 5 nights. The facilities were excellent. Everyday we went to the extensive and delicious (included) breakfast on the roof-top of the main hotel which has a spectacular view. I highly recommend this hotel, also for the wonderful location relative to tourism. All the hotel staff were very helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “i felt as if it was my home”
Reviews.Author: shohreh_golazad
Reviews.Content: we spent 2 weeks in turkey,but i dare say ,my stay in Tashkonak suit in istanbul was the best part of it.not ignoring great location,nice breakfast,but the highly responsible and helpful receptionist ,Mr.Hayati,is the unforgetable. he offered us a suit although we had booked and payed for a double room.and when we decided to stay 2 more nights,he did his best to save the same suit for us. the sea within a 5 minute walk;nice,safe and calm destrict;helpful staff with a good knowledge of english are qualifications that distinguishes tashkonak of istanbul. thank you so much Mr.Hayati

Reviews.Title: “Very near Historic Areas of Istanbul and very good apartments and hotel”
Reviews.Author: luc31
Reviews.Content: - Very near Historic Areas of Istanbul - very good apartments and hotel - quiet, clean - very good staff - very good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nacera_11
Reviews.Content: I recommend totally this very beautiful hotel. Very clean, a personal is helpful and discreet. This Hotel has a magnificent terrace with an impressive view on the Marmara Sea. The breakfast is standard but sufficient. Best .

Reviews.Title: “Could'nt have chosen better”
Reviews.Author: h_legault
Reviews.Content: We are retired persons and we were going to Turkey for the first time. We travel as a couple and not with a group. However we had been to Europe before and know for a fact that in the range of price we were looking for the rooms are small. We needed space for a 7 day stay. That is how by looking through the reviews on trip Advisor we found the Taskonak Hotel and the Tashknonak Suites and Apartment which is situated in the Sultanahmet district. We looked at the photos and decided on a room in the Suites. The one we wanted was available for a very good price for 7 days. It included the transport from the Airport Ataturk to the hotel wich was the best thing we could ask for. Someone was waiting at the Airport with our name on a sign, could'nt have been better. We made our reservations through internet and got a confirmation within 24 hours. On arrival at the suite it was exactly what we had been looking at on Internet. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable and had a little kitchen counter to make ourselves coffee. We had seating chairs and a small desk to do Internet. There was space and the bathroom was big. This Hotel and the Suites are situated within walking distance of the most important tourist attractions. In fact you have everything you need within 5 minutes walks such as restaurants, busses, tram, grocery store, ATM in Euros or Liras. Every morning we would go to the Hotel to have our breakfast on the rooftop. Then of with our day of visiting. All the staff, everyone of them, although some of them didn't even speak english, were polite and seemed to love the work they were doing. Every day coming back to the hotel was like coming home and having someone take interest in what you did. We didn't have to go to the tourist office the hotel was doing a great job. When we go back to Istanbul, and we will, this will be our hotel. Huguette & Jean The Canadians

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, welcoming staff, but a bit scruffy”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCelt
Reviews.Content: I booked here because needed a hotel in Istanbul at very short notice and everything else was too expensive. It normally stay at rather more upmarket hotels, so was a little worried when I arrived. But the stay was fine. I had a very large family room to myself, with a balcony with an excellent view. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is near the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, so ideal if you are on vacation. I booked an airport transfer via the hotel and was met by a very comfortable mini-bus which had a fridge with cold drinks. Would be a particularly good option if travelling with a group. My main criticism was that the room itself was rather scruffy and clearly hadn't been redecorated or refurnished for many years. This is the reason I only rank the hotel as "Average" and why I wouldn't recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel at the heart at of old Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: nevala
Reviews.Content: Skillful, helpful and friendy personnel, elegantly renovated Studio Suites situated at the heart of Sultanahmet, marvellous views on breakfast terrace, tourist attractions round the corner, ... The price-quality ratio for our stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for a family!”
Reviews.Author: Spinnacl
Reviews.Content: We had a spacious room (even with the two extra cots) with lots of windows. The kids enjoyed hanging out in the room watching all kinds of street vendors walk by selling fruits, vegetables, fish, and bread. We felt part of the city life. The street is surprisingly quiet for its downtown location. There is a small laundrymat a few steps away and great restaurants nearby with wonderful lentil soup. The fish dinner at the hotel was superb. There is a corner store at every corner. Everything was easily accessible - bank machines, tourist attractions, convenience stores, and shopping (horse stall market). We had a wonderful time and enjoyed the warm hospitality of the Tashkonak staff.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Cozy Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SwissTrippy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tashkonak and enjoyed the warm and friendly atmoshphere from the staff. I enjoyed the at-home feel with the decor and the outside garden patio. The staff was always there to greet us each day and wish us a good night. They also took their time to help with transportation and places of interest around the city. We chose this hotel for its close proximity to the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sofia, Hippodrome, and the Basilica Cistern. We also appreciated having free internet access from our room. The most difficult part of our stay here was the noise from the outside. We had a street-facing room and enjoy sleeping with the windows open versus having the air conditioning running. With our proximity to the front desk it was hard to avoid the conversations at the front desk and louder conversations in the reception area. The surrounding neighborhood included listening to cats fighting, dogs barking, the broadcasted prayers, traffic, and people talking on the street.

Reviews.Title: “A small, well run hotel, a stone's throw from the Blue Mosque.”
Reviews.Author: OneFullStop
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, clean and beautifully furnished, having a nice, individual touch, unusual for a budget hotel. Although we were seperate from the main block, and the reception desk, staff were quick to help with any queries we had, arriving at the door within minutes. Breakfast, which again was in the main block, was pleasant and plentiful, and as it ran until 10.30, making the short trip round the corner to get it was no problem. The location of the hotel was central enough to make visiting tourist destinations easy, whilst the back street location meant that it was quiet and gave a feel of the 'real' Instanbul. I would have no doubts about returning to the Tashkonak.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettably Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: nose_wheel
Reviews.Content: Tashkonak is located @ d heart of the tourist spots. Its a best place to lodge for budget travellers. It would only take you 15 min walk to reached HAgia Sophia,Blue Mosque,Hippodrome Square and the Topkapi Palace. Within that area also you can take the tram to visit the other nearby cities.Turks as well are very friendly. Food are affordable and when you buy for souvenirs, you can haggle for the price. Dont forget to have a taste of their dessert..the turkish delight...fantastic! If you are on a budget and dont wanna splurge much on the hotel..book it to Tashkonak...staffs are very accommodating and friendly. would give tips on how to go around Istanbul. and if u need anything at the hotel, they would not hesitate to offer their help.breakfast at the hotel is superb with a view of the bosphorous bridge, overlooking the Asia part of Turkey. Indeed it was a wonderful experience...surely we will come back again if given the chance! our stay in istanbul and at the tashkonak is truly.................UNFORGETABLY AMAZING!

HotelInfo.Name: Tashkonak Suites & Apartment
HotelInfo.Address: Kucuk Ayasofya Street Kapiagasi Sokak No:7 Sultanahmet | Kapiagasi Sokak No:7, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
